choices.answer: Data Based Question
Document Based Question
Do Be Quiet
Don’t Be Questioning

questions.question: Which of these is necessary when writing a response to DBQ’s?

choices.answer: A strong specific claim
Evidence that actually supports your claim
Reasoning that clearly connects the claim and evidence
ALL of these
A strong political group committed to maintaining slavery
The political group of Andrew Johnson
The political group that wanted to give Black people equal rights
The group that lost power when the South lost the Civil War

questions.question: In your opinion who won the debate?

choices.answer: Trump
Biden
The American People
We all took an L on Wednesday night
Lincoln’s Vice President and the President after Lincoln was killed
A Radical Republican who wanted to give Black people equal rights
A Southerner who did not believe in equal rights for Black people
A wealthy land owner who supported helping rich Southerners

questions.question: What was the purpose of Reconstruction?

choices.answer: To heal the country and rebuild it after the Civil War
To punish the south for betraying the Union
To make sure all people were given equal rights
It depends on who you speak to from that time

questions.question: What can the president do when Congress tries to pass a law they don’t like?

choices.answer: Call on members of Congress to vote against it
They have no choice but to accept it if more than half of Congress sign it
Hope there’s a tie so that their Vice President decides the outcome
Veto it

questions.question: Which of these is the MOST painful?

choices.answer: Standardized Testing (I’d rather gouge my eyes out)
Back to back to back to back classes on a computer (tldr)
Trying to find a space to work in peace (I swear my house ain’t a zoo)
The number of assignments we’re given (can I breathe)

questions.question: Which of these should you do when answering a DBQ?

choices.answer: Panic
Put the question into your own words (rephrase it)
Identify and rephrase words you don’t understand
Skip it and hope you do better on the other sections

questions.question: What did this person do well when answering yesterday’s DBQ?

choices.answer: Their claim is specific
Their evidence actually supports their claim
Their reasoning explains the quote and connects it to their claim
All of these

questions.question: What could we do to make this answer to the DBQ stronger?

choices.answer: It’s Perfect
It needs a more specific claim
Change the quote to better support the claim
It needs a quote as evidence

questions.question: Which part of answering a DBQ do you feel is the hardest?

choices.answer: Knowing the right answer to the question
Writing a specific claim
Finding the evidence to support my claim
Coming up with the reasoning that connect my evidence and claim

questions.question: How would you use Among Us in the classroom?

choices.answer: As a fun thing we can do in advisory
As a way to practice argumentation and argumentative writing
As a reward for students who are completing all of their work
I wouldn’t. It’s fun and I don’ want school to ruin it for me
